START.name: Introduction
START.desc:
'Ah you've awoken! It's about time!' You blink rapidly and your eyes begin to focus on a short and stout man.  He has a crooked nose, a scruffy beard, a bloodied brow and an overall ragged appearance.  You don't recognize him or remember how you wound up in the field.  You ask him who he is.

Strange man: 'Ay Lad, I'm Sir Gerald the Grande.  If ye don't know who I am then you must've gotten hit in the noggin pretty hard.  I've seen you around the castle plenty a times.' 

He offers you his hand.

STAND.name: Introduction continued
STAND.desc:
You take his hand, stand up, and take in your surroundings. 

First you notice the scattered, beaten and bloodied bodies lying in the fields around you.  You cringe and feel even more confused as you still can't recall a thing.  Then your eyes wander to a tall, stone castle to your North which looks like its seen better days.  The drawbridge is up, and the place doesn't seem at all inviting.  Despite the scene before you, the environment feels remarkably calm, and the birds sing as if nothing has happened.  You turn towards Sir Gerald only to realize he is significantly shorter than you first observed. You perceive him to be a dwarf and ask him what happened here. 

Sir Gerald: 'Ain't it obvious?  There was a battle this morning - started late last night when the king was murdered.  According to the whispers, the kind was poisoned by his greedy no good brother.  Good thing I hid when I heard the shouts.  See, I'm only the royal treasurer; I don't have any battle experiience.  It's a shame though. He was a decent king.  Not too many of those as of late, someone's always hungerin' for power nowadays.  Too many arrogant, greedy kings...' the dwarf rambled. 

You: 'So what am I supposed to do exactly? I don't even remember what happened.'

Sir Gerald: 'Well yer the last living knight of the former king, so I figure ya gotta find and rescue the princess.'

You: 'How will that help things?'

Sir Gerald: 'It might not, but the whispers say she's got some magical powers or somethin'.  Maybe she can restore peace?' He shrugs and starts to turn away. 'Well best of luck to ye.  Oh! Take this with ye on yer quest!' He hands you a lightweight, sharp steel sword that seemingly came from nowhere. It's so shiny that it seems as if it's never left the armory.  Although a bit shorter than you would have preferred, it'll serve you well, nevertheless.

Sir Gerald: 'Hopefully it'll be of some use to you - more than it's been to me at least. Farewell!'

The dwarf heads off into the woods to your South, away from the castle.

GROUND.name: Lying in a field awkwardly
GROUND.desc: Sir Gerald stares at you curiously. You should probably take his hand before things get awkward.

WCASTLE.name: West of the Castle
WCASTLE.desc: This is an open field west of a tall stone castle. There is no door on this side of the castle, and the walls are to high to scale without rope.

NCASTLE.name: North of the Castle
NCASTLE.desc:
You are standing in a field, facing the north side of a tall stone castle. There is no door here,
and all the windows are too tall to scale without a rope.

SCASTLE.name: South of the Castle
SCASTLE.desc:
You are standing in a field and facing the south side of a tall, stone castle. There is a large wooden drawbridge but it is lifted up,
and all the windows are too tall to scale without rope.

ECASTLE.name: East of the Castle
ECASTLE.desc: This is an open field east of a tall stone castle. There is no door on this side of the castle, but there is a lovely watch tower that is too tall to scale without a rope.

DRWBRDG.name: Drawbridge: entrance to the Castle
DRWBRDG.desc: This a drawbridge. It can only be opened from the inside of the castle.

RAVINE.name: A field overlooking a perilous ravine
RAVINE.desc: It's a beautiful ravine, but it's rather large and the river down there looks pretty threatening. You can't cross it. I recommend going another direction.

FORE1.name: Forest West of Castle
FORE1.desc: This is a forest, with somewhat tall trees surrounding you. Light peaks through the canopy, and there are footpaths leading to the north, west, and south. The sounds of a river seem to be coming from further west.

FORE2.name: Forest South of Castle
FORE2.desc:
This is a dimly lit forest, with large leafy trees surrounding you.  To the
west, there appears to be a footpath and sunlight.

RIVER.name: Riverbank
RIVER.desc: This is a wide but calm river. You might be able to cross it, but the bushes on the other side are too thick. You would need a sword to cut through them. To the north of the river you see a footpath. To your south, there's a steep wall of a mountain. You can't go this way.

FORE3.name: Forest North of Castle
FORE3.desc:
This is a dimly lit forest, with large, leafy green trees surrounding you. To the west there appears to be sunlight and a footpath. One
particularly large tree with some low branches stands here.

TREE.name: Up a Tree
TREE.desc: You've climbed the tree and breached the canopy to see smoke coming from a chimney off to the West.

FORE4.name: Forest far north of Castle
FORE4.desc:
This is a large forest, with trees obstructing all views except
to the west, where a small clearing and a cottage can be seen through the trees.

COTTAGE.name: Small cottage
COTTAGE.desc: This is a small stone cottage. The door appears to be ajar, and there's a little smoke coming from the chimney.

LROOM.name: in the living room of a small cottage
LROOM.desc: You enter the cottage and walk into the living room. There doesn't seem to be much here except an old rocking chair, a small circular wooden table with basic wood chairs and a worn out rug. It seems as though the previous owners left in a hurry. If you continue, you'll enter the bedroom. If you go right, you enter the kitchen.

BEDROOM.name: in the bedroom of a small cottage
BEDROOM.desc: This room is just as dull as the last. There's only a bed, a wardrobe and a hooded cloak haphazardly thrown over a nearby chair. You grab it just for funsies.

KITCH.name: in the kitchen of a small cottage
KITCH.desc: There's a coal stove in the corner with a few burning embers. It seems as though it hasn't been used in several hours. There's also a counter, a small makeshift tin sink, and a tiny window facing east towards... a tower?

FORE5.name: in forest North West of the abandoned castle
FORE5.desc: This is more forest, with trees surrounding you from all directions. There is a particularly tall tree with many thick branches gradually circling the trunk in an upwards spiral.

TREE2.name: Up the Spiral Tree
TREE2.desc: You climb the tree and survive with only a few scrapes on your knees. You breach the canopy to see smoke coming from a chimney off to the South West and a tall brick tower to the NorthEast.

ELF.name: near a kidnapped elf
ELF.desc: You're following the stream when you hear distant shouts. You approach cautiously to discover an elf tied to a tree with rope. Near the elf are two trolls who are debating the best way to cook elf. They're boiling a cauldron of water and their backs are turned away from the miserable elf.
